meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that regulates appetite or hunger.
meanings.sent1: The appestats in the kitchen help control how much food we eat.
meanings.sent2: The scientist invented a new appestats to help people manage their cravings.
meanings.sent3: The appestats at the buffet seemed to be on vacation, as everyone kept eating.
meanings.sent4: Her willpower acted like an appestats, keeping her from overindulging in sweets.
meanings.sent5: The appestats hummed softly, reminding him to eat in moderation.

meanings.definition: The part of the brain that controls appetite and hunger.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the appestats on the brain scan, indicating the area responsible for hunger.
meanings.sent2: When she felt hungry, she knew her appestats were sending signals to eat.
meanings.sent3: His appestats seemed to be in overdrive, making him crave snacks all day.
meanings.sent4: The appestats in her brain whispered for more food, even though she was full.
meanings.sent5: The appestats in his brain were like a bossy chef, always demanding more food.

meanings.definition: A system in the body that regulates food intake.
meanings.sent1: The appestats in his body worked efficiently to keep his weight stable.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the appestats help maintain a healthy balance of nutrients.
meanings.sent3: Her appestats seemed confused, causing her to feel hungry even after a big meal.
meanings.sent4: The appestats in his body were like traffic lights, controlling when to eat and when to stop.
meanings.sent5: The appestats in her body were like little guardians, ensuring she didn't overeat.
